meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a typhoon.
meanings.sent1: The typhonic winds were strong and destructive.
meanings.sent2: The storm had a typhonic force that caused widespread damage.
meanings.sent3: The typhonic weather made it impossible to go outside without getting soaked.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a typhonic force, sweeping away everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The typhonic nature of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the characteristics of a typhoon.
meanings.sent1: The typhonic clouds gathered ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The waves had a typhonic intensity, crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The typhonic sound of the thunder made the children giggle with excitement.
meanings.sent4: His temper was typhonic, flaring up suddenly and then calming just as quickly.
meanings.sent5: The typhonic atmosphere in the room made everyone uneasy.
